meanings.definition: To sink or bend downward under weight or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge began to sag under the heavy truck.
meanings.sent2: His shoulders sagged with exhaustion after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The bag of groceries made the plastic handle sag comically.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits seemed to sag like a deflating balloon after the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The wilting flower sagged sadly in the heat of the sun.

meanings.sent1: The old mattress had a noticeable sag in the middle.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch had a slight sag under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent3: The sag in his pants made him look like a clown.
meanings.sent4: The sag of the hammock invited her to relax and sway gently.
meanings.sent5: The sag of the old roof hinted at years of neglect.

meanings.definition: A decrease or decline in value or quality.
meanings.sent1: The company experienced a noticeable sag in profits this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The sag in the housing market affected many homeowners.
meanings.sent3: The sag in the movie's ratings surprised the critics.
meanings.sent4: The sag in her grades motivated her to study harder.
meanings.sent5: The sag in the economy caused concern among investors.
